comments:
SDOUtil.java does not support attribute name including character '.'  in Xpath.
For example:
Dataobject mydataObject has a array attribute "BO.attribute". I want to get the first Object in the array using:
SDOUtil.get(mydataObject, "BO.attribute.0");
I get exception: 
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Class 'BO' does not have a feature named  
'BO'
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.getEStructuralFeature(SDOUtil.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.setFeatureName(SDOUtil.java:834)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process(SDOUtil.java:933)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.init(SDOUtil.java:725)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create(SDOUtil.java:645)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.get(SDOUtil.java:162)

Could you please help to resolve the problem? 
By the way, in current SDO implement, are there any "." limitation in other classes and any other characters limitation? Thank you very much for your help.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 169815 ***

traces.message: Class 'BO' does not have a feature named   'BO'
